**A. Preparation of mouse embryonic fibroblast feeder cells.
Add 0.1v/w% Gelatin solution to 100 mm-culture dish, and
Incubate for 2 hr to overnight \(Geratin coat).
2. Harvest embryonic day 13.5 mouse embryos from pregnant female mice.
Separate embryos from placenta with forceps.
Move the head, visceral tissues and gonads from isolated embryos, and
Wash embryos with PBS at least twice.
Centrifuge tube containing PBS, and mince embryos into small tissue fragment by using a pair of scissors.
Centrifuge 50 mL tube containing embryos at 1,000 rpm for 5 min.
Add 10 mL MEF medium, and repeat pipetting 5-10 times.
Transfer this solution containing digested tissue to 100 µm Cell strainer to
Optional; if the solution contains a sticky water, you can
Add DNase I solution \(Takara Bio) to
DNase digestion helps the solution to go through the Cell Strainer well.
Collect the solution passed through the strainer.
Transfer the cell suspension to 100-mm culture dish \(1 embryo per 100-mm culture dish.), and culture at 37°C with 5% CO<sub>2</sub> overnight.
After 3-4 d culture, the MEF cells will become confluent.
Passage to new Gelatin-coated 150-mm culture dish at 1:4 dilution with 0.25w/v% trypsin digestion.
Optional; you can stop cell culture at each
Centrifuge at 1,000 rpm for 5 min, and re-
Store MEF cells with Cell banker 1 solution at -80°C for 6 months.
After passaging 2-3 times, culture the MEF cells again until the cells become confluent.
Change with fresh 12.5 mL MEF medium in addition to 70 μL of 2 mg/mL MMC solution.
Incubate at 37°C with 5% CO<sub>2</sub> for 2.5 to 3 hr.
Wash out MMC solution with fresh PBS twice, and
Digest the MEF cells with 0.25w/v% trypsin at 37°C for 5 min. After the digestion,
Add fresh MEF medium to stop trypsin activity,
Harvest the MMC-treated MEF cells, and
Centrifuge at 1,000 rpm for 5 min. Re-
Suspend in the MEF medium and
Transfer the MMC-treated MEF cells to Geratin-treated 60-mm culture dish \(Generally, we
Obtain total 60-mm dish confluent MEF cells from 150-mm dish confluent MEF cells after MMC treatment).
Then, culture the MMC-treated MEF cells overnight.
Store feeder cells as frozen stocks, you may re-
Suspend the cells in Cell banker 1 \(Takara Bio) instead of the MEF medium after the centrifugation of MMC-treated MEF cells.
After the aspiration of supernatant from centrifuged MMC-treated MEF cells suspension, and gently re-
Pellet in 1 mL Cell banker 1 solution,
Dispense 1 mL Cell banker 1 solution to a vial, and
Store these frozen stocks for 1 months.
When you need the MMC-treated MEF cells as feeder cells,
Transfer frozen stock of the MMC-treated MEF cells from -80°C and
Incubate at 37°C until a half of frozen solution thaw, and
Change with fresh MEF medium, you can use these MMC-treated MEF cells as feeder cells for ES cells culture.
Store the MMC-treated MEF cells for 2-3 d, but we recommend you to use it as feeder cells immediately.
Prepare the feeder cells \(MMC-treated MEF cells cultured on 60-mm dish;
See Procedure A. 1) before starting ES cells culture.
Prepare 10 mL pre-warmed ES medium in 15 mL
2. Transfer frozen stock of E14 ES cells from -80°C and
Incubate at 37°C until a half of frozen solution thaw, and
Suspend the cells in 10 mL pre-warmed ES medium.
On the bottom of vial may contain small ES cells pellet, so that you should repeat pipetting 3-5 times in fresh ES medium to
After transferring ES cells to 15 mL tube, Centrifuge at 1,000 rpm for 5 min. During the centrifugation,
Aspirate the MEF medium from feeder cells culture dish.
Aspirate the supernatant from 15 mL tube, re-
Pellet in 5 mL fresh ES medium by pipetting 7-10 times to
Culture ES cells at 37°C with 5% CO<sub>2</sub> overnight.
Aspirate old ES medium from 60-mm culture dish, and
Continue to culture ES cells at 37°C with 5% CO<sub>2</sub> for another 2 d without changing medium.
Obtain several ES cell colonies on feeder cells.
Culture ES cells at 37°C with 5% CO<sub>2</sub> for another 1 d.
Prepare another feeder cells from frozen stock \(See Procedure A) for the following ES cells passage.
After 1 d culture of feeder cells,
Change medium of feeder cells with ES medium \(NOT MEF medium) in advance to
Wash the ES cells with PBS twice,
Add 500 μL 0.25w/v% trypsin solution directly to the ES cells,
Then, repeat pipetting 7-10 times vigorously to
Harvest only 50 μL of single ES cells suspension, and
Transfer to feeder cells containing ES medium.
Culture ES cells at 37°C with 5% CO<sub>2</sub> overnight.
Pellet to single cell for ES cells culture in good condition.
Continue to culture ES cells at 37°C with 5% CO<sub>2</sub> for another 2 d without changing medium.
Optional; you may stop ES cells culture instead of going to next differentiation steps.
Digest the ES cells 0.25w/v% trypsin at 37°C for 5 min. After digestion,
Add fresh ES medium to stop trypsin digestion,
Centrifuge at 1,000 rpm for 5 min. Aspirate supernatant and gently re-
Pellet in the Stem Cell banker solution \(Takara Bio),
Dispense this solution to vial, and
Store these frozen stocks at -80°C for 1 month, or in liquid nitrogen for 6 months to 1 year.
**C. Differentiation of EBs with both endoderm and mesoderm.
Aspirate Geratin solution before you start EB formation.
Transfer these ES cells suspension to fresh 10 mL EB medium in 15 mL tube, and
Centrifuge at 1, 000 rpm for 5 min. After the centrifugation,
Transfer it to Geratin coated 100-mm dish.
Remaining LIF in ES medium inhibits the differentiation of ES cells, and results in poor EB formation.
See huge amount of MEF cells attached on dish, but not small ES cells.
Harvest supernatant containing only ES cells,
Centrifuge at 1,000 rpm for 5 min. Aspirate supernatant, re-
Count the number of cells, and estimate the volume of suspension containing 5.0 x 10<sup>4</sup> ES cells.
The number of starting cells is important for better EB formation, please
1. Transfer these suspension containing 5 x 10<sup>4</sup> ES cells to 10 mL EB medium in Reservoir \(Corning).
Dispense 100 μL ES cells suspension to each ultra-low attachment 96 well \(Generally, each well contains 500 ES cells).
Culture 37°C with 5% CO<sub>2</sub> for 6 d \(We term this starting day as d 0).
Change the medium for 6 d during EB formation.
EBs self-form both mesoderm and endoderm by autocrine growth factors.
4. d 1, Check the EB formation by microscopy.
Prepare 5 mL fresh KSR medium in 15 mL tube.
Harvest EB one by one from each 96 well by using 200 μL ultra-low attachment
Incubate at room temperature for 5 min to let EBs go down to the bottom of
Wash out remaining EB medium from EBs \(
Incubate at room temperature for 5 min again to let EBs go down to the bottom of
Add 2 mL DS medium, and re-
Transfer DS medium containing EBs to Geratin-coated 6 well dish.
**D. Differentiation of stomach primordium from EBs.
Confirm all EBs attached on the dish, and then
Culture at 37°C with 5% CO<sub>2</sub> for 3 d.
d 10, Change with fresh DS medium.
Culture at 37°C with 5% CO<sub>2</sub> for 3 d.
d 13, Change with fresh DS medium.
See small dome structure differentiated from EBs.
Culture at 37°C with 5% CO<sub>2</sub> for 3 d.
d 16, Change with fresh DS medium.
Culture at 37°C with 5% CO<sub>2</sub> for 3 d.
d 19, Change with fresh KSR medium.
Culture at 37°C with 5% CO<sub>2</sub> for 3 d. You can
See small dome structure differentiated into huge spheroids, and show motility \(See ref. 2).
Culture at 37°C with 5% CO<sub>2</sub> for 3 d.
Check stomach primordium-like structure in culture, you can stop culture by adding 4% PFA solution \(Wako) and
Stain the cells against Sox2, Barx1 \(Chemicon), and EpCAM antibodies \(See ref.
**E. Differentiation of stomach tissue from primordium.
d 22, Change with fresh KSR medium.
Culture at 37°C with 5% CO<sub>2</sub> for 3 d.
d 25, Change with fresh KSR medium.
Culture at 37°C with 5% CO<sub>2</sub> for 3 d.
d 27, Prepare Matrigel solution \(See Reagent set up).
Add the growth factor cocktail including 100 ng/mL FGF10, 100 ng/mL WNT3A, 100 ng/mL NOGGIN, and 250 ng/mL R-SPONDIN1 \(All from R&D Systems) to 75-100 μL liquid Matrigel, and gently
Matrigel solution should be stored on ice until you use.
Wash the culture spheroids with PBS twice, and
Transfer this culture dish under the microscopy.
Harvest only spheroids carefully by autoclaved-forceps.
Transfer spheroids to 75-100 μL liquid Matrigel containing growth factors on ice, and
Transfer these Matrigel containing spheroids to 12 well culture plate, and make a droplet.
Incubate at 37°C for 30 min for polymerization of Matrigel.
Add FGF-based medium gently on Matrigel droplet.
Culture at 37°C with 5% CO<sub>2</sub> for 14 d, and
Change FGF medium every 4 d \(so-called 3D culture).
Obtain more huge organoids after 14 d culture, and we called this huge spheroids as e-ST \(
Wash the e-ST with fresh PBS, and
Digest Matrigel for at 37°C for 15 min. After digestion,
Examine Muc5ac \(Santacruz), Pgc \(Abcam), and H+/K+ATPase \(Abcam) expression by immunofluorescence staining \(
Optional; after 42 d culture with FGF-based medium, you may continue to culture FGF medium from d 46 to d 60.
See more developed e-ST with deep grand morphology \(
